content: 1. Which of the following strategies is typically referred to as "strategic analysis"?

answers.text: a) Unique decisions about product development
b) the development of a new marketing campaign
c) The analysis of the competitive landscape
d) the implementation of a new software

content: 2. Which of the following statements best describes the role of a "corporate value level"?

answers.text: a) It is a measure of the company's financial performance.
b) It is a measure of the company's social responsibility.
c) It is a measure of the company's ability to achieve long -term goals.
d) It is a measure of the number of employees.

content: 3. Which of the following tasks belongs to the area of "operationalization"?

answers.text: a) the development of a new marketing campaign
b) the implementation of a new software
c) The analysis of the competitive landscape
d) the creation of presentations for investors

content: 4. What does "Market-Based View" mean in the context of competitive strategy?

answers.text: a) a strategy based on the competition.
b) a strategy based on the analysis of the market.
c) a strategy based on the use of the competition as an opportunity.
d) a strategy based on avoiding competition.

content: 5. Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of "financial planning"?

answers.text: a) Financial planning is only important for large companies.
b) Financial planning is an essential part of the corporate strategy.
c) Financial planning only focuses on achieving profit.
d) Financial planning is only for the budget of the budget.
a) a form of corporate communication.
b) a metric used to measure the success of a project.
c) a detailed description of the corporate strategy.
d) An analysis of customer needs.

content: 7. Which of the following statements is best relevant to describe the "internal core competencies"?

answers.text: a) The number of employees who work in the department.
b) the company's ability to develop certain products or services.
c) the company's expertise in a certain market segment.
d) the number of investments that are made in corporate development.

content: 8. Which of the following statements is best relevant to the topic of "internal strategy"?

answers.text: a) The strategic planning that the company suggests for the future.
b) The development of products or services that are tailored to the customer.
c) Adjusting the strategy to the changing market conditions.
d) the decisions about the production processes.

content: 9. What does "change management" mean in the context of corporate development?

answers.text: a) the introduction of new technologies.
b) The adaptation of processes and structures to new circumstances.
c) the implementation of marketing campaigns.
d) the training of employees.

content: 10. What is a "competitive strategy" in the context of the corporate strategy?

answers.text: a) the development of new products.
b) The analysis of competitors and the development of strategies to stand out from them.
c) the creation of presentations for investors.
d) The organization of events for customers.

content: 11. Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of "competitive strategy" in a global context?

answers.text: a) The competitive strategy is only relevant for companies in the USA.
b) The competitive strategy is of crucial importance for companies that work in various markets.
c) The competitive strategy is only relevant for companies with a large market share.
d) The competitive strategy is irrelevant for companies that work in a small market.

content: 12. Which of the following statements best describes the role of "financial planning"?

answers.text: a) Financial planning is only for the achievement of profit.
b) Financial planning is an essential part of the corporate strategy.
c) Financial planning only focuses on achieving profit.
d) Financial planning is only for the budget of the budget.

content: 13. Which of the following statements best describes "project management"?

answers.text: a) A process for planning and controlling projects.
b) the creation of marketing campaigns.
c) the organization of company events.
d) the development of new products.

content: 14. What is "key performance indicator" (KPI) in the context of project management?

answers.text: a) a metric used to measure the success of a project.
b) a form of corporate communication.
c) a detailed description of the corporate strategy.
d) An analysis of customer needs.

content: 15. Which of the following statements best describes the role of "stakeholder management"?

answers.text: a) communication with customers.
b) the consideration of the interests of various parties involved in a project.
c) the creation of presentations for investors.
d) the implementation of marketing campaigns.
a) An analysis of the competition.
b) An analysis of the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and risks of a company.
c) An analysis of the financial situation of a company.
